summary: Build a responsive, modern Online Learning Platform website for Polytechnic (Diploma) students across multiple branches, providing study materials, question papers, MCQ practice, search, authentication, downloads, and an admin upload panel using a simple web stack (HTML/CSS/JS or React) with a lightweight backend (Firebase/Node.js/PHP) and database.
architectural_notes: Support branches: Computer Engineering, IT, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Electronics, Automobile.
Content should be organized by branch and semester, with subject-wise pages.
Backend can be Firebase, Node.js, or PHP with a database for users/materials/MCQs.
Design target: modern, minimal, light colors, readable fonts, icons/cards; responsive + accessible + fast-loading.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal flat educational icon for Computer Engineering (branch-computer.dim_256x256.png)
- Minimal flat educational icon for IT (branch-it.dim_256x256.png)
- Minimal flat educational icon for Mechanical Engineering (branch-mechanical.dim_256x256.png)
- Minimal flat educational icon for Electrical Engineering (branch-electrical.dim_256x256.png)
- Minimal flat educational icon for Civil Engineering (branch-civil.dim_256x256.png)
- Minimal flat educational icon for Electronics Engineering (branch-electronics.dim_256x256.png)
- Minimal flat educational icon for Automobile Engineering (branch-automobile.dim_256x256.png)

existing_features.title: Create a coherent, modern, minimal educational UI theme (light colors, readable typography, clear spacing, card-based layouts) and apply it consistently across all pages with full responsiveness (mobile/tablet/desktop) and accessible contrast/focus states.

Implement the core information architecture and navigation: Home, Branch (by branch), Semester (within branch), Subject (within semester), Study Materials, Question Papers, MCQ Practice, Syllabus Overview, Search Results, Login/Register, Admin Panel.
Model and display the supported branches: Computer Engineering, IT, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Electronics, and Automobile, including branch landing pages that list semesters and subjects.

Implement student authentication using Internet Identity and store a user profile record on first login; support a basic Register/Login UX that uses Internet Identity and shows logged-in state in the UI.

Implement role-based access control for an Admin Panel: only authorized admin principals can access admin routes and perform upload/manage actions; unauthorized users are blocked from admin UI actions.
Implement study materials (PDF notes) module: subject-wise listing, file upload via Admin Panel, metadata (title, branch, semester, subject, year/term, tags), and a download action for students.
Implement previous years’ exam question papers module: subject-wise listing, file upload via Admin Panel, metadata (year, exam type/term if provided), and download action.

Implement MCQ features: (1) browse MCQs with answers and explanations (if provided), (2) MCQ practice mode that randomizes or sequences questions, captures user selections, and displays score at the end.
Implement syllabus overview pages per subject (or per branch/semester when applicable) and show them in a clear, readable format on the subject page.
Add a global search bar that searches across subjects, notes, question papers, and MCQs; show categorized results and allow navigation to the relevant subject/content.
Ensure the app is simple, fast-loading, and accessible: use efficient client-side data fetching/caching, show loading/empty/error states, and avoid unnecessary large assets on initial load.
Add static generated icons/illustrations for the seven branches and display them on branch cards and/or headers.

new_feature_requests.summary: Responsive, clean student-friendly UI (mobile/tablet/desktop) with modern minimal educational theme
Home page listing course categories by branch and semester
Branch sections (Computer, IT, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Electronics, Automobile) with subject-wise organization
Study materials module: subject-wise PDF notes with download support
Previous years’ exam question papers module with download support
MCQ module: MCQs with answers and practice mode
MCQ practice scoring and score display
Global search to find subjects, papers, or MCQs quickly
Admin panel to upload/manage notes, papers, and MCQs
Simple, fast-loading, accessible site behavior and performance considerations
Backend + database to store users, study materials metadata/files, and MCQs (Firebase/Node.js/PHP acceptable)

Create backend data models and CRUD endpoints for: branches, semesters, subjects, notes (PDF), question papers (PDF), MCQs (question, options, correct answer, optional explanation), and syllabus overview text/structure.

projectName: Online Learning Platform for Polytechnic Diploma Students (Branches, Materials, MCQs, Search, Admin)
